body_html: @albanD yes cudnn only supports int sizes and strides, so we often do this conversion. I presume because long indexing math is much more expensive on GPU which doesn't have as many double-width cores, they made this tradeoff.
body_text: @albanD yes cudnn only supports int sizes and strides, so we often do this conversion. I presume because long indexing math is much more expensive on GPU which doesn't have as many double-width cores, they made this tradeoff.
body: @albanD yes cudnn only supports int sizes and strides, so we often do this conversion. I presume because long indexing math is much more expensive on GPU which doesn't have as many double-width cores, they made this tradeoff.
